title: What is the danger of giving in to sexual desire according to this text?
first_phrase: In this text, the author warns readers of the dangers of giving in to their sexual desires. They explain how surrendering to lust can lead to becoming an instrument of the demon one desires to conquer, serving the woman rather than transcending it. The text references the Table of the Hermetic Treasure (Ms. Jung, 558) and the teachings of art (') as secrets to help one avoid falling prey to the innate enemy of sensuality. The author reminds readers that to attain the cosmic elevated bliss and a sensation-free pleasure, one must not become attached to pleasure, but rather remain active, quintessential, and absorptive.

last_phrase: In conclusion, to become an adept in the practice, do not focus on yourself but on the pleasure of the woman you desire. The ability to transform this pleasure into a fluidic element that unites both partners is essential. However, bear in mind that the ultimate goal is not to get lost in the state of cosmic ecstasy alone, but to use it as a means of transcendence. It is crucial to differentiate between the mere pursuit of pleasure and the active conversion of it to achieve esoteric transformation.
